menu.utils

Class FontToMesh

  • java.lang.Object
    • menu.utils.FontToMesh

  • public class FontToMesh
extends java.lang.Object
    This class generates and lazyloads meshes corresponding to glyphs. One instance corresponds to one Font.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static float spacingRatio 
      static FontToMesh standardExtrudedFont 
      static FontToMesh standardFlatFont 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FontToMesh(java.awt.Font font, boolean extruded)
      Creates a FontToMesh from a java font.
      FontToMesh(java.lang.String fontName, boolean extruded)
      Convenience method to load a font from its name.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      com.jme3.scene.Mesh getGlyphMesh(char c)
      Creates if needed, and returns the mesh for the given glyph.
      com.jme3.math.Vector3f getGlyphSize(char c) 
      com.jme3.scene.Node getStringNode(java.lang.String string)
      Gets the mesh for every character, then returns the global geometry, for the given string.
      boolean isExtruded()

        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • FontToMesh

        public FontToMesh(java.lang.String fontName,
          boolean extruded)
        Convenience method to load a font from its name.
        Parameters:
        fontName - The name of the font used (E.g. "Arial").
        extruded - If true, the mesh will be a true 3D letter, else it will be flat and only contain the front of the letter.

      • FontToMesh

        public FontToMesh(java.awt.Font font,
          boolean extruded)
        Creates a FontToMesh from a java font.
        Parameters:
        font - The java.awt font to use.
        extruded - If true, the mesh will be a true 3D letter, else it will be flat and only contain the front of the letter.

    • Method Detail

      • getStringNode

        public com.jme3.scene.Node getStringNode(java.lang.String string)
        Gets the mesh for every character, then returns the global geometry, for the given string.
